review_title: I wouldn't recommend anyone work here
pros: I thank Spectrum for the experience I acquired while working for the company. 2 years of counseling / clinical work. Spectrum does offer assistance with licensure / education if the employee is interested, however, you must be ready to sign a contract with them.
cons: Spectrum's turnover rate is the worst I've ever seen in any company I've worked for. This creates desperation in the hiring process. Spectrum will hire almost anyone that is willing to do the job, even if they are not qualified. The employees who have committed a minimum amount of time (6+ months) get promoted to supervisors and hire new employees. This creates a cycle of "the blind leading the blind." Supervision is a joke. Most supervisors are not even qualified / licensed to supervise others. The drama you'll get involved in while working with this company will have you thinking you're back in high school. The biggest con of this all... Spectrum does not seem to do anything different to better the environment.
